availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Silas Adams (Union Lt. Col, kentucky attorney.)

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, soldier. Pulaski County native. Son of James Adams and Malinda Adams. Attended Kentucky University in Harrodsburg, Kentucky, and Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. First lieutenant, captain, lieutenant colonel, and colonel in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from July 22, 1861, to December 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Casey County, District 2, p. 41.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0001.

Find A Grave, "Silas Adams (February 9, 1839-May 5, 1896)," Memorial #7182511, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/7182511 (accessed October 9, 2018).
